Example - subscribe to the "select" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the user clicks the "Export to PDF" toolbar button.

children.description: Fires when the user depresses a keyboard key. Triggered multiple times if the user holds the key down.

Example - subscribe to the "execute" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when Editor is blurred and its content has changed.

children.name: value
children.description: Gets or sets the editor value.

children.name: state

parameters.name: toolName `String`
parameters.description: The name of the tool that will be tested if formatted.

children.description: Get the state of a given tool. Introduced in the 2013.2.923 internal build.

children.name: update
children.description: Serializes the current state of the editable area to the `<textarea>` element.This method should be called after modifying the editor content through the DOM.

children.name: selectRange

parameters.name: range `Range`
parameters.description: The **Range** object that describes the new selection.

children.description: Focuses the editable area and selects the range described by the range parameter.

children.name: saveAsPDF
children.description: Initiates the PDF export and returns a promise. Also triggers the [pdfExport](#events-pdfExport) event.> Calling this method may trip the built-in browser pop-up blocker. To avoid that, call this method as a response to an end-user action, e.g. a button click.

children.name: refresh
children.description: Reinitializes the editing area iframe. Should be used after moving the editor in the DOM.

children.name: selectedHtml
children.description: Serializes the currently selected text to a XHTML string.

children.name: paste
Example - insert text content, preserving formatting

parameters.name: options.split `Boolean` *(default: true)*
parameters.description: Specifies whether the surrounding formatting should be split prior to inserting the HTML. If set to `false`, the inserted snippet will inherit styles from the surrounding content.

parameters.name: options `Object`
parameters.description: Options that configure how the content is processed when pasting.

children.description: Inserts HTML into the editable area. Cleans up MS Word formatting.

children.name: getSelection
children.description: Gets a W3C-compatible **Selection** object form the editable area.

children.name: getRange
children.description: Gets a **Range** object form the editable area.

children.name: focus
children.description: Focuses the editable area.

children.name: exec

parameters.name: params.value `Object`
parameters.description: The arguments for commands that expect such

parameters.name: params `String|Object` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The parameters for the executed command.

parameters.name: name `String`
parameters.description: The name of the command to be executed. The available names match the list of [tools](#configuration-tools), plus `"undo"` and `"redo"`.

children.description: Executes an editor command on the currently selected text.

children.name: encodedValue
children.description: Gets the HTML encoded value of the editor.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the widget for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the Editor element from DOM.

children.name: createRange

parameters.name: document `Document` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The document that the range is associated with. If omitted, the document of the editor editing area will be used.

children.description: Creates a W3C-compatible **Range** object.

children.name: fileBrowser.transport.create.url
Example - specify create url as function

children.description: The remote url to call when creating a new record.

children.name: fileBrowser.transport.create.type
children.description: The type of request to make (`"POST"`, `"GET`", `"PUT"` or `"DELETE"`), default is "POST".Refer to the [jQuery.ajax](http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax) documentation for further info.

children.name: fileBrowser.transport.create.dataType
children.description: The type of data that you're expecting back from the server. Commonly used values are `"json"` and `"jsonp"`.Refer to the [jQuery.ajax](http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax) documentation for further info.

children.name: fileBrowser.transport.create.data
children.description: Data to be send to the server.Refer to the [jQuery.ajax](http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax) documentation for further info.

children.name: fileBrowser.transport.create.contentType
children.description: The content-type HTTP header sent to the server. Default is `"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"`. Use `"application/json"` if the content is JSON.Refer to the [jQuery.ajax](http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax) documentation for further info.

children.name: fileBrowser.transport.create
children.description: Options or URL which will handle the directory creation. If not specified that create new folder button will not be present.> **Important:** The value of `transport.create` is passed to [jQuery.ajax](http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax).

children.description: The remote url to call when creating a new record.

children.name: fileBrowser.transport.destroy

children.name: imageBrowser.path
children.description: Defines the initial folder to display, relative to the root.

children.name: imageBrowser.fileTypes
children.description: Defines the allowed file extensions.

children.name: imageBrowser
children.description: Configuration for image browser dialog.

children.name: tools.template
Example using a Kendo UI template with variables
Example using a simple string template

children.description: The kendo template that will be used for rendering the given tool.

children.name: tools.items.context
children.description: Only applicable for the formatting tool. Specifies the context in which the option will be available.

children.name: tools.items.value
children.description: The value that will be applied by the tool when this item is selected.

children.name: tools.items.text
children.description: The string that the popup item will show.

children.name: tools.items
children.description: For tools that display a list of items (fontName, fontSize, formatting), this option specifies the items in the shown list.

children.name: tools.exec
children.description: The JavaScript function which will be executed when the end-user clicks the tool button.

children.name: tools.tooltip
children.description: The text which will be displayed when the end-user hovers the tool button with the mouse.

children.name: tools.name
children.description: When specifying a tool as an object, a tool name is required. **Please note that "undo" and "redo" are reserved tool names.**

children.name: tools
children.description: A collection of tools that are used to interact with the Editor.Tools may be switched on by specifying their name.Custom tools and tools that require configuration are defined as objects.The available editor commands are:*   Basic text formatting        - **bold**, **italic**, **underline**, **strikethrough**, **subscript**, **superscript***   Font and color        - **fontName**, **fontSize**, **foreColor**, **backColor***   Alignment        - **justifyLeft**, **justifyCenter**, **justifyRight**, **justifyFull***   Lists        - **insertUnorderedList**, **insertOrderedList**, **indent**, **outdent***   Links, images and files        - **createLink**, **unlink**, **insertImage**, **insertFile***   Table editing        - **createTable**, **addColumnLeft**, **addColumnRight**, **addRowAbove**, **addRowBelow**, **deleteRow**, **deleteColumn***   Structural markup and styles        - **formatting**, **cleanFormatting***   Snippets        - **insertHtml***   HTML code view        - **viewHtml***   Print edited page        - **print***   Export to PDF        - **pdf**

children.name: stylesheets
children.description: Allows custom stylesheets to be included within the editing area. This setting is applicable only when the [Editor is initialized from a `textarea`](/web/editor/overview)and a contenteditable iframe is generated.

children.name: serialization.semantic
children.description: Indicates whether the font styles will be saved as semantic (strong / em / span) tags,or as presentational (b / i / u / font) tags. Used for outputting content for legacy systems.

children.name: serialization.scripts
children.description: Indicates whether inline scripts will be serialized and posted to the server.> Setting this option does not prevent cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks; you need server sanitization, too.> See the [preventing cross-site-scripting](/web/editor/preventing-xss) help topic for more information.

children.name: serialization.entities
children.description: Indicates whether the characters outside the ASCII range will be encoded as HTML entities. By default, they are encoded.

children.name: serialization
children.description: Allows setting of serialization options.

children.name: resizable.toolbar
children.description: If `resizable` is set to `true` the widget will detect changes in the viewport width and will hide the overflowing controls in the tool overflow popup.> Tools are shown/hidden on tool group level. Tools with popup such as `fontName`, `fontSize`, `fontColor`, `backColor` and `formatting` will be hidden but **not** moved to the tool overflow popup.

children.name: resizable.max
children.description: The maximum height that the editor can be resized to.

children.name: resizable.min
children.description: The minimum height that the editor can be resized to.

children.name: resizable.content
children.description: If enabled, the editor renders a resize handle to allow users to resize it.

children.name: resizable
children.description: If enabled, the editor renders a resize handle to allow users to resize it.

children.name: pdf.title
children.description: Sets the title of the PDF file.

children.name: pdf.subject
children.description: Sets the subject of the PDF file.

children.name: pdf.proxyTarget
Example - open the generated document in a new window

children.description: A name or keyword indicating where to display the document returned from the proxy.If you want to display the document in a new window or iframe,the proxy should set the "Content-Disposition" header to `inline; filename="<fileName.pdf>"`.

children.name: pdf.proxyURL
Example - set the server proxy URL

children.description: The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally e.g. Internet Explorer 9 and Safari. PDF export is not supported in Internet Explorer 8 and below.The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:* contentType: The MIME type of the file* base64: The base-64 encoded file content* fileName: The file name, as requested by the caller.The proxy should return the decoded file with the "Content-Disposition" header set to`attachment; filename="<fileName.pdf>"`.

children.name: pdf.paperSize
children.description: Specifies the paper size of the PDF document.The default "auto" means paper size is determined by content.> The size of the content in pixels will match the size of the output in points (1 pixel = 1/72 inch).Supported values:* A predefined size: "A4", "A3" etc* An array of two numbers specifying the width and height in points (1pt = 1/72in)* An array of two strings specifying the width and height in units.  Supported units are "mm", "cm", "in" and "pt".

children.name: pdf.margin.top
children.description: The top margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin.right
children.description: The right margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin.left
children.description: The left margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin.bottom
children.description: The bottom margin. Numbers are considered as "pt" units.

children.name: pdf.margin
children.description: Specifies the margins of the page (numbers or strings with units). Supportedunits are "mm", "cm", "in" and "pt" (default).

children.name: pdf.landscape
children.description: Set to `true` to reverse the paper dimensions if needed such that width is the larger edge.

children.name: pdf.keywords
children.description: Specifies the keywords of the exported PDF file.

children.name: pdf.forceProxy
children.description: If set to true, the content will be forwarded to [proxyURL](#configuration-pdf.proxyURL) even if the browser supports saving files locally.

children.name: pdf.fileName
Example - set the default PDF file name

children.description: Specifies the file name of the exported PDF file.

children.name: pdf.date
children.description: The date when the PDF document is created. Defaults to `new Date()`.

children.name: pdf.creator
children.description: The creator of the PDF document.

children.name: pdf.avoidLinks
children.description: A flag indicating whether to produce actual hyperlinks in the exported PDF file.It's also possible to pass a CSS selector as argument. All matching links will be ignored.> Available in versions 2015.3.1020 and later

children.name: pdf.author
children.description: The author of the PDF document.

children.name: pdf
children.description: Configures the Kendo UI Editor PDF export settings.

children.name: messages.deleteColumn
children.description: The title of the tool that deletes selected table columns.

children.name: messages.deleteRow
children.description: The title of the tool that deletes selected table rows.

children.name: messages.addRowBelow
children.description: The title of the tool that adds table rows below the selection.

children.name: messages.addRowAbove
children.description: The title of the tool that adds table rows above the selection.

children.name: messages.addColumnRight
children.description: The title of the tool that adds table columns on the right of the selection.

children.name: messages.addColumnLeft
children.description: The title of the tool that adds table columns on the left of the selection.

children.name: messages.createTableHint
children.description: The status text of the tool that inserts tables, which indicates the dimensions of the inserted table.

children.name: messages.createTable
children.description: The title of the tool that inserts tables.

children.name: messages.dialogCancel
children.description: The label of the cancel button in all editor dialogs.

children.name: messages.dialogInsert
children.description: The label of the insert button in all editor dialogs.

children.name: messages.dialogUpdate
children.description: The label of the update button in all editor dialogs.

children.name: messages.linkOpenInNewWindow
children.description: The caption for the checkbox for opening the link in a new window in the createLink dialog.

children.name: messages.linkToolTip
children.description: The caption for the link Tooltip in the createLink dialog.

children.name: messages.linkText
children.description: The caption for the link text in the createLink dialog.

children.name: messages.linkWebAddress
children.description: The caption for the URL in the createLink dialog.

children.name: messages.fileTitle
children.description: The caption for the file title in the insertFile dialog.

children.name: messages.fileWebAddress
children.description: The caption for the file URL in the insertFile dialog.

children.name: messages.imageHeight
children.description: The caption for the image height in the insertImage dialog.

children.name: messages.imageWidth
children.description: The caption for the image width in the insertImage dialog.

children.name: messages.imageAltText
children.description: The caption for the image alternate text in the insertImage dialog.

children.name: messages.imageWebAddress
children.description: The caption for the image URL in the insertImage dialog.

children.name: messages.directoryNotFound
children.default: "A directory with this name was not found."
children.description: The error message shown when the target directory is not found in the file- or imageBrowser.

children.name: messages.overwriteFile
children.default: 'A file with name "{0}" already exists in the current directory. Do you want to overwrite it?'
children.description: The confirmation message shown when overwriting files in the file- or imageBrowser.

children.name: messages.deleteFile
children.default: 'Are you sure you want to delete "{0}"?'
children.description: The confirmation message shown when deleting files in the file- or imageBrowser.

children.name: messages.invalidFileType
children.default: 'The selected file "{0}" is not valid. Supported file types are {1}.'
children.description: The error message shown when an invalid file type has been selected in the file- or imageBrowser.

children.name: messages.orderByName
children.description: The sorting order by name in the file- or imageBrowser.

children.name: messages.orderBySize
children.description: The sorting order by size in the file- or imageBrowser.

children.name: messages.orderBy
children.description: The caption of the sorting order in the file- or imageBrowser.

children.name: messages.editAreaTitle
children.description: The title of the iframe editing area when a sandboxed editor is used. Used as a hint for screen readers.

children.name: messages.uploadFile
children.description: The caption of the upload button in the file- or imageBrowser.

children.name: messages.emptyFolder
children.description: The message shown in the file- or imageBrowser when a folder is empty.

children.name: messages.style
children.description: The title of the tool that applies styling to elements. Deprecated.

children.name: messages.backColor
children.description: The title of the tool that changes the text background color.

children.name: messages.foreColor
children.description: The title of the tool that changes the text color.

children.name: messages.formatting
children.description: The title of the tool that lets users choose block formats.

children.name: messages.formatBlock
children.description: The title of the tool that lets users choose block formats. Deprecated.

children.name: messages.fontSizeInherit
children.description: The text that is shown when the text size will be inherited from the surrounding page.

children.name: messages.fontSize
children.description: The title of the tool that changes the text size.

children.name: messages.fontNameInherit
children.description: The text that is shown when the text font will be inherited from the surrounding page.

children.name: messages.fontName
children.description: The title of the tool that changes the text font.

children.name: messages.viewHtml
children.description: The title of the tool that shows the editor value as HTML.

children.name: messages.insertHtml
children.description: The title of the tool that inserts HTML snippets.

children.name: messages.insertFile
children.description: The title of the tool that inserts links to files.

children.name: messages.insertImage
children.description: The title of the tool that inserts images.

children.name: messages.unlink
children.description: The title of the tool that removes hyperlinks.

children.name: messages.createLink
children.description: The title of the tool that creates hyperlinks.

children.name: messages.outdent
children.description: The title of the tool that outdents the content.

children.name: messages.indent
children.description: The title of the tool that indents the content.

children.name: messages.insertOrderedList
children.description: The title of the tool that inserts an ordered list.

children.name: messages.insertUnorderedList
children.description: The title of the tool that inserts an unordered list.

children.name: messages.justifyFull
children.description: The title of the tool that justifies text both left and right.

children.name: messages.justifyRight
children.description: The title of the tool that aligns text on the right.

children.name: messages.justifyLeft
children.description: The title of the tool that aligns text on the left.

children.name: messages.justifyCenter
children.description: The title of the tool that aligns text in the center.

children.name: messages.subscript
children.description: The title of the tool that makes text subscript.

children.name: messages.superscript
children.description: The title of the tool that makes text superscript.

children.name: messages.strikethrough
children.description: The title of the tool that strikes through text.

children.name: messages.underline
children.description: The title of the tool that underlines text.

children.name: messages.italic
children.description: The title of the tool that makes text italicized.

children.name: messages.bold
children.description: The title of the tool that makes text bold.

children.name: messages
children.description: Defines the text of the labels that are shown within the editor. Used primarily for localization.

children.name: encoded
children.description: Indicates whether the Editor should submit encoded HTML tags. By default, the submitted value is encoded.

children.name: domain
children.description: Relaxes the same-origin policy when using the iframe-based editor.This is done automatically for all cases except when the policy is relaxed by document.domain = document.domain.In that case, this property must be used to allow the editor to function properly across browsers.This property has been introduced in internal builds after 2014.1.319.
